intro.title: Introduction
intro.content: This Privacy Policy describes how Nearby Community ("we", "our", or "the app") handles information when you use our mobile application. We are committed to protecting your privacy and being transparent about our data practices. This app is designed with privacy as a core principle - we operate on a peer-to-peer basis without central servers.

dataCollection.title: 1. Information We Collect
dataCollection.content:
Nearby Community is designed to minimize data collection. The app collects and processes the following information locally on your device:

• Device Identifier: A temporary, encrypted identifier used for device discovery
• Broadcast Name: The display name you choose to share with nearby users
• Chat Messages: Messages you send and receive during active sessions
• Device Information: Basic device details needed for Bluetooth and Wi-Fi Direct connectivity

IMPORTANT: All data is processed locally on your device. We do not collect, store, or transmit your personal information to any external servers or third parties.

permissions.title: 2. Permissions Required
permissions.content:
To provide peer-to-peer connectivity, the app requires the following permissions:

• Bluetooth Scan, Connect & Advertise: To discover and connect with nearby devices using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE)
• Nearby Wi-Fi Devices: To enable Wi-Fi Direct connections for faster data transfer (Android 13+)
• Location (Android 13 and below): Required by Android OS for Bluetooth scanning on older versions. We do NOT track your location
• Notifications: To alert you of new messages and connection events

These permissions are used exclusively for peer-to-peer functionality and are never used to track, monitor, or collect data about you.

dataUsage.title: 3. How We Use Information
dataUsage.content:
Information processed by the app is used exclusively for:

• Device Discovery: Enabling you to find and be found by nearby devices
• Peer-to-Peer Communication: Facilitating direct messaging between devices
• Connection Management: Maintaining stable connections during active sessions
• User Experience: Displaying your chosen broadcast name to other users

All processing occurs locally on your device. Messages and connections are ephemeral - they exist only during active sessions and are not permanently stored or transmitted to external servers.

dataStorage.title: 4. Data Storage and Retention
dataStorage.content:
• Local Storage Only: All data is stored locally on your device using encrypted databases
• No Cloud Storage: We do not upload or sync your data to any cloud services
• Temporary Data: Device discovery information and active connections are temporary and automatically cleared
• Chat History: Messages are stored locally on your device and can be deleted at any time
• User Control: You have complete control over your data and can clear it by uninstalling the app

dataSharing.title: 5. Data Sharing and Disclosure
dataSharing.content:
We do NOT share, sell, rent, or disclose your information to third parties. The app operates entirely peer-to-peer:

• No Third-Party Services: We do not integrate analytics, advertising, or tracking services
• No Data Transmission: Your data never leaves your device except during direct peer-to-peer communication with devices you explicitly connect to
• User-Controlled Sharing: You control what information you share by choosing your broadcast name and the messages you send
• No Government or Legal Requests: Since we don't collect or store your data, we have nothing to provide to third parties

security.title: 6. Security Measures
security.content:
We implement multiple security measures to protect your information:

• End-to-End Encryption: All peer-to-peer communications are encrypted
• Encrypted Storage: Local databases use encryption to protect stored data
• Secure Identifiers: Device identifiers are encrypted and temporary
• No Central Point of Failure: Peer-to-peer architecture eliminates server-based vulnerabilities
• Permission Controls: Android's permission system ensures you control what the app can access

childrenPrivacy.title: 7. Children's Privacy
childrenPrivacy.content: Nearby Community does not knowingly collect information from children under 13 years of age. The app is designed for general audiences and does not target children. Since we do not collect personal information or use central servers, we cannot determine the age of users. Parents and guardians should supervise children's use of the app and ensure they understand safe communication practices.

yourRights.title: 8. Your Privacy Rights
yourRights.content:
You have complete control over your data:

• Access: All your data is stored locally on your device and accessible to you
• Deletion: Uninstalling the app permanently deletes all local data
• Control: You choose what information to share and with whom
• Transparency: This policy explains exactly what data is processed and how
• No Tracking: We do not track your behavior, location, or usage patterns

Since we do not collect or store your data on external servers, there are no data portability or correction requests needed - you already have full control.

thirdParty.title: 9. Third-Party Services
thirdParty.content:
Nearby Community does NOT integrate any third-party services, including:

• No Analytics Services: We do not use Google Analytics, Firebase Analytics, or similar services
• No Advertising Networks: The app is ad-free and does not integrate advertising SDKs
• No Social Media Integration: We do not connect to social media platforms
• No Cloud Services: We do not use cloud storage or backup services
• No Crash Reporting: We do not use third-party crash reporting tools

This ensures your data remains private and is never shared with external parties.

international.title: 10. International Data Transfers
international.content: Since Nearby Community operates entirely peer-to-peer without central servers, there are no international data transfers to or from our organization. When you connect with another user, data is transmitted directly between devices using local wireless technologies (Bluetooth and Wi-Fi Direct). The geographic location of data transfer depends solely on where you and the devices you connect with are physically located.

changes.title: 11. Changes to This Policy
changes.content:
We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or for legal, operational, or regulatory reasons. When we make material changes, we will:

• Update the "Last Updated" date at the top of this policy
• Notify users through the app or app store update notes
• Provide at least 30 days notice for significant changes

Continued use of the app after changes become effective constitutes acceptance of the updated policy. We encourage you to review this policy periodically.

compliance.title: 12. Legal Compliance
compliance.content:
Nearby Community is designed to comply with:

• GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation): European privacy standards
• CCPA (California Consumer Privacy Act): California privacy rights
• COPPA (Children's Online Privacy Protection Act): Children's privacy protection
• Google Play Store Policies: Android app distribution requirements

Our peer-to-peer, no-server architecture inherently provides strong privacy protections that exceed many regulatory requirements.

contact.title: 13. Contact Us
contact.content:
If you have questions, concerns, or requests regarding this Privacy Policy or our privacy practices, please contact us through:

• App Support: Use the in-app support channels
• Email: Contact information available on our website
• App Store: Leave feedback through the Google Play Store

We are committed to addressing your privacy concerns promptly and transparently. Your privacy and trust are important to us.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.content: Nearby Community is committed to providing a safe environment for all users. This Child Safety and Abuse Enforcement (CSAE) policy outlines our safety standards, contact information, and measures to protect users, especially minors, in compliance with Google Play's child safety standards policy for social and dating category apps.

commitment.title: 1. Our Commitment to Child Safety
commitment.content:
We are dedicated to:

• Protecting minors from inappropriate content and interactions
• Preventing child sexual abuse and exploitation (CSAE)
• Maintaining a zero-tolerance policy for illegal content
• Providing transparent safety standards and reporting mechanisms
• Cooperating fully with law enforcement agencies
• Continuously improving our safety measures and policies

ageRequirements.title: 2. Age Requirements
ageRequirements.content:
Nearby Community has the following age requirements:

• Minimum Age: Users must be at least 13 years of age
• Parental Consent: Users under 18 should have parental supervision
• Age Verification: While we don't collect personal data, users are responsible for meeting age requirements
• Teen Safety: We recommend parental guidance for all users under 18

By using this app, you confirm that you meet the minimum age requirement for your jurisdiction.

safetyFeatures.title: 3. Safety Features
safetyFeatures.content:
Our app includes built-in safety features:

• Local-Only Communication: All communications are peer-to-peer without central servers
• User Control: Users control who they connect with and what information they share
• No Profile System: No public profiles or user directories that could be exploited
• Ephemeral Connections: Connections are temporary and user-initiated
• Encryption: All communications are encrypted end-to-end
• No Location Tracking: We do not track or store user locations

contentModeration.title: 4. Content Moderation
contentModeration.content:
Due to our peer-to-peer architecture:

• Direct Communication: Messages are sent directly between devices without server intermediation
• User Responsibility: Users are responsible for the content they share
• Blocking Capability: Users can disconnect from any device at any time
• No Content Storage: We do not store or have access to user communications
• Community Standards: Users must comply with our Terms of Service and community guidelines

While we cannot moderate real-time peer-to-peer communications, we provide tools for users to protect themselves.

reporting.title: 5. Reporting Mechanisms
reporting.content:
If you encounter inappropriate content, abuse, or safety concerns:

• Immediate Action: Disconnect from the device immediately
• Report to Us: Contact nearcomapp{'@'}gmail.com with details
• Law Enforcement: Report illegal activity to local authorities
• Emergency: Call emergency services (911, 112, etc.) for immediate threats
• Documentation: Save any relevant information (device names, timestamps)

We take all reports seriously and will cooperate fully with law enforcement investigations.

privacyProtection.title: 6. Privacy Protection for Minors
privacyProtection.content:
We protect user privacy, especially for minors:

• No Personal Data Collection: We do not collect names, emails, phone numbers, or addresses
• No Location Tracking: Location permissions are only used for Bluetooth functionality, not tracking
• Local Storage Only: All data stays on the user's device
• No Third-Party Sharing: We never share user data with third parties
• COPPA Compliance: Our design inherently protects children's privacy
• Parental Control: Parents can monitor app usage through device-level controls

prohibitedContent.title: 7. Prohibited Content and Behavior
prohibitedContent.content:
The following are strictly prohibited:

• Child Sexual Abuse Material (CSAM): Any content exploiting minors
• Grooming: Attempts to build relationships with minors for exploitation
• Harassment: Bullying, threats, or intimidation of any user
• Illegal Content: Any content that violates local, national, or international laws
• Hate Speech: Content promoting violence or hatred
• Sexual Content: Explicit sexual content or solicitation
• Impersonation: Pretending to be someone else

Violations will result in immediate reporting to authorities and cooperation with investigations.

parentalGuidance.title: 8. Parental Guidance and Resources
parentalGuidance.content:
We recommend parents and guardians:

• Supervise Usage: Monitor children's use of communication apps
• Discuss Safety: Talk to children about online safety and appropriate behavior
• Set Boundaries: Establish rules about who children can communicate with
• Use Device Controls: Utilize parental control features on devices
• Stay Informed: Review our privacy policy and safety guidelines
• Report Concerns: Contact us immediately if you have safety concerns

Parental involvement is crucial for ensuring children's online safety.

contact.title: 9. Contact Information
contact.content: For child safety concerns, abuse reports, or questions about our safety policies:

emergencyResources.title: 10. Emergency Resources
emergencyResources.content:
If you or someone you know is in immediate danger:

• Emergency Services: Call 911 (US), 112 (EU), or your local emergency number
• National Center for Missing & Exploited Children (NCMEC): CyberTipline.org or 1-800-843-5678
• FBI Internet Crime Complaint Center: ic3.gov
• INHOPE Hotline Network: inhope.org (international)
• Local Law Enforcement: Contact your local police department

For non-emergency concerns, use our safety contact information above. We are committed to working with authorities to ensure user safety.
